summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General sworn interview transcript of a BOP employee, the former Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on June 15, 2021. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, including security protocols, staffing, cell mate assignments, and potential failures in supervision and documentation at the MCC.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive with Homemade Fabric
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cell mate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff. Epstein claimed Tartaglione tried to kill him, but an investigation found the claim not credible, suggesting Epstein was engaging in manipulative behavior.

events.title: Efrain Reyes Released from Court
events.description: Epstein's cell mate, Efrain Reyes, went to court and was released, not returning to MCC. Staff failed to notify superiors, leaving Epstein without a cell mate. Multiple required counts (4:00 PM, 10:00 PM) in the SHU were not conducted.

events.title: Epstein's Final Phone Call Authorization
events.description: In the evening, Captain Jermaine authorized Unit Manager to allow Epstein a monitored, unrecorded phone call from the SHU. He instructed to log the call, but does not know if the log was completed.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Around 6:30-6:45 AM, Officer found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his SHU cell. Officer entered the cell without a supervisor present to initiate life-saving efforts. Lieutenant called Captain Jermaine to report the incident.

events.title: Missing Inmate File and Altered Logs
events.description: Upon arriving at MCC after Epstein's death, Captain Jermaine discovered Epstein's SHU inmate file was empty, suggesting documents were removed. He also observed discrepancies and potential alteration/deletion of the Lieutenant's daily log from the overnight shift.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a sworn, voluntary interview with former MCC Captain Jermaine as part of its investigation into the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
Ten South (Special Management Unit) at MCC
West Side Administrative Building, FCI Fort Dix, New Jersey
Federal Law Enforcement Training Center, Glynco, Georgia
keyFacts: Epstein was not housed in his assigned cell for six days prior to his death due to administrative failures in updating Sentry paperwork, though he was found in the cell he was physically occupying.

Multiple critical security protocols failed: the 4:00 PM, 10:00 PM, 12:00 AM, 3:00 AM, and 5:00 AM counts in the SHU on August 9-10 were not conducted, and camera footage showed the two officers on duty sleeping.

Epstein's SHU inmate file was found empty immediately after his death, leading the witness to believe documents were 'purposefully taken.' The Lieutenant's daily log from the overnight shift also appeared to have been altered or deleted.

The witness states that high-profile inmates like Epstein had 'orange cards' indicating need for high visibility, but the specific directive that Epstein must have a cell mate at all times was verbally communicated primarily to the SHU Lieutenant and not formally documented in an all-staff email.
The SHU camera system was reportedly down, and the camera technician (Mr. Daniels) and facilities manager () knew but did not notify the Captain, constituting a security failure.
